title: Langold Lake Country Park Walking Route

images.title: Steve F, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Langold Lake Country Park car park. A view of the car park and one of the footpaths heading into the lush green parkland on this summer day.

images.title: Ashley Dace / Looking towards Langold Lake
images.caption: Looking towards Langold Lake. A large man made lake build for a hall that was never built. The foundations were put in somewhere.

images.title: Ashley Dace / Country Park
images.caption: A small cafe is pictured here. This green was once a freight spur connecting Firbeck Colliery to Harworth Junction.

images.title: Ashley Dace / Firbeck Main colliery
images.caption: Firbeck Main colliery. The colliery from the spoil heap. The coal is about 780 metres below ground. The building to the left is the old engine shed seen here

images.title: Michael Patterson / Langold Lake
images.caption: A view of the surfaced footpath along Langold Lake

images.title: Michael Patterson / County Bridge
images.caption: County Bridge. This bridge carries a footpath over the small brook on the western side of the park. To the right of the bridge is South Yorkshire and to the left is Nottinghamshire.

description: Enjoy woodland, wildlife meadows and two pretty lakes in this 300 acre country park near Worksop. The walk starts at the car park and takes you along Langold Lake and through Dyscarr Woods before returning to the start point. There's also plenty of wildlife to see with the park designated as a Local Nature Reserve. The park is great for children with a play area and water park for them to splash about in. The park is located a few miles north of Worksop where you can continue your walking along the Chesterfield Canal .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's a small on site cafe selling meals and hot drinks.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The park is very dog friendly with a waymarked Dogs Trust walking route to try. The woodland trails and lakeside paths are popular with dog owners so you'll probably bump into a few on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: A few miles south west of the site there's another fine country park in the shape of Rother Valley Country Park. There's a series of lakes and a watersports centre here. Harthill Reservoir and Pebley Reservoir are also located just east the site. Just to the south of Worksop there's one of the highlights of the area at Clumber Park. There's 3,800 acres of woodland, open heath and rolling farmland to explore here. A couple of miles to the south east there's Hodsock Priory to explore. The historic park is open to the public in February for the annual snowdrop walks. All year round you can explore the wider estate on a circular public footpath though. For more walking ideas in the area see the Nottinghamshire Walks page.

display_address: 23, Church Street, Hodsock, Langold, Bassetlaw, Nottinghamshire, East Midlands, England, S81 9NW, United Kingdom
